metadata.title: CVE-2023-29455 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Reflected XSS attacks, also known as non-persistent attacks, occur when amalicious script is reflected off a web application to the victim'sbrowser. The script is activated through a link, which sends a request to awebsite with a vulnerability that enables execution of malicious scripts.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29455` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 5.0.35rc1
zabbix-agent2 - 5.0.35rc1
zabbix-frontend-php - 5.0.35rc1
zabbix-java-gateway - 5.0.35rc1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 5.0.35rc1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 5.0.35rc1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 5.0.35rc1
zabbix-server-mysql - 5.0.35rc1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 5.0.35rc1
zabbix-web-service - 5.0.35rc1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.35rc1').
